text:
Hi everyone, I love this Slack space for HubSpot nerds. If anyone needs anything please let me know I am very resourceful and connection rich, pretty tech savvy too!

Our organization hosts college students for academic credit. One of our students is really concerned that our *PRINT button on the student recipe blogs* they create that it doesn't actually work. I am unsure how to fix this. Any advice?

The print feature with picture and without on my raw HTML code is not working.(<https://www.assuaged.com/news/one-pot-plant-based-mexican-soup>)

I did find this *<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16894683/how-to-print-html-content-on-click-of-a-button-but-not-the-page|resource here>*. It seems that the Print Button housed in a custom module with code that I'm not familiar with.  Looking at the code, it appears that a link to actually _print_ that page is missing. *<https://docs.google.com/document/d/12eD13QB_FGcy67IFTcspdWQV3lR5TshBgFVGnnfbm4c/edit?usp=sharing|>> Here is the code <<>* we have on our end from HubSpot Design Manager. Thank you so much!!

Hello again <@U0286RC226S>, You’re getting a JavaScript error when you click on the print button: “Uncaught ReferenceError: ccmpr is not defined”. Do you know where the ccmpr function lives?

I don’t know what the ccmpr function does but you could change the onclick attribute from `ccmpr();` to `window.print();`. This will fix the print issue but you have a lot of print styles issues as well.
I tried the code and it didn't work
I am unsure where ccmpr, I looked in the design manager, very strange!
Thank yoooou so much for the help :heart: I am still sifting around, maybe I can post in HubSpot community
